subject: Education
title: Student Data Privacy: Who Owns Your Learning Record?
description: Learn Student Data Privacy: Who Owns Your Learning Record? in one minute.

hook.text: Your child's reading level, quiz scores, and learning pace are stored in a company's cloud. Forever.

buildup.text: EdTech platforms collect massive amounts of student dataâ€”clicks, errors, time spent, even mouse movements.

discovery.text: FERPA and COPPA provide some protection, but enforcement is weak and loopholes are wide.

twist.text: Some companies sell anonymized student data to advertisersâ€”anonymization is easily reversed.

climax.text: Students have no say in what data is collected about them or how it's used.

punchline.text: If the product is free, the student's data is the product.

quiz.question: What is a major concern about EdTech student data?
options: Companies collect extensive data with weak enforcement of privacy protections
Too little data is collected to be useful
Students eagerly consent to all data collection
